events.name: What's Now Singapore: Blockchain
events.description:
Dear attendee,
On behalf of Capgemini Singapore, it is our pleasure to extend our warmest invitation to Capgemini's second edition of "What's Now Singapore" at our Applied Innovation Exchange (AIE) on Thursday, 31 August 2017.
The AIE is Capgemini’s global platform that leverages a framework for action, a network of exchange locations, and a high performance engagement experience together with a broad community of designers, technologists, sector experts, business, technology partners, research organizations and startups. The idea is to enable organizations to proactively plan for and respond to the various technology and business shifts which are confronting them on a daily basis.
"What's Now Singapore" happening at the AIE is a quarterly conversation stimulated by local thought leaders, centered on the current and upcoming key technology trends as well as the most important innovations emerging in Singapore right now. Each session will feature a group of subject matter experts in one of the many areas exploding with innovation – the experts who can explain the big story, what’s most important now, and what’s coming next. Over the course of a year, we will explore a range of sectors – from AI to biotech to clean energy to food – that make Singapore ground zero for breakthroughs that soon will impact the rest of the world.
The second session of “What’s Now Singapore” will focus on Blockchain. 
Blockchain
Blockchain technology is set to revolutionize the flow of transactions and the daily lives of hundreds of millions of people around the world. Industries like financial services, cybersecurity, education, healthcare, supply chain, and governments have begun to explore the application of Blockchain for a variety of uses. However, most uses remain experimental.
At Capgemini, we have already begun designing Blockchain solutions for banking and financial services. Thanks to Blockchain technology, by 2022, the banking sector is projected to save between 15 to 20 billion dollars.
“Banks and Insurance companies can no longer afford to ignore the Blockchain. This technology will completely transform the industry’s business model.” - Nilesh Vaidya, Vice-President of Capgemini Financial Services
With the advantages of greater transparency and robust security, hear from four Blockchain technology experts to understand what the buzz is about Blockchain and how it can add value to your company’s digital transformation.
Join us at “What’s Now Singapore” on 31 August to find out more.
Please see below for programme agenda:
6:30pm: Registration
6:50pm: Welcome remarks and introduction to the AIE
7:00pm: Introduction to cryptocurrencies - Gavin Low, Blockchain Technology Enthusiast 
7:15pm: Cryptocurrency - Peter Sin, Financial Specialist & Cryptocurrency Enthusiast
7:30pm: Smart contracts and its applications - Paul Griffin, Associate Professor, Singapore Management University
7:45pm: Blockchain: Role in corporate digital transformation - Floyd D'costa, Co-founder, Blockchain Foundry
8:00pm: Fireside chat with panelists - Moderator: David Wilson, Head of Asia Wealth Management, Global Financial Services, Capgemini
8:30pm: Networking and refreshments
events.location: Applied Innovation Exchange, Capgemini, 6 Battery Road, #12-02, Singapore 049909

events.name: Understanding Cybersecurity: Blockchain - Why it's Truly Groundbreaking?
events.description: What is Blockchain? Why is it groundbreaking? Despite all the news on importance of blockchain and how it could change our digital life, not many people can explain in layman’s term how the technology is so different from other internet tech and its role in our lives. This event will go in depth to address the topic. This talk is an continuation of the article https://www.techinasia.com/talk/explain-blockchain-wife. The author, Antony, will cover on what Blockchain is and how the physical properties will be brought into a virtual world. Please have a look at the article before coming for the event. The talk will be delivered by Mr Antony. With 15 years of experience in banking, audit, and IT security, he has experiences working for big tech organisations including Verizon and IMDA (formerly IDA).
events.location: Tri5 Ventures, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent #03-26, S139951, Singapore

events.name: Mobile Apps Preview Session
events.description:
Join us for the 2 Hours Mobile Apps Preview Workshop to learn more about developing a mobile enterprise application for small medium businesses (SMBs). You will also understand more about cloud-based application builder to design, develop and publish mobile applications for Apple iOS and Android OS.
Find out how you can use your SkillsFuture credit on this course with Avantus!
events.location: Devan Nair Institute, Jurong, 80 Jurong East Street 21 #04-04 Devan Nair Institute, Singapore 609607
